HARMONY_ModalInterchange.name: Modal Interchange / Borrowed Chords
HARMONY_ModalInterchange.description: Using chords from parallel major/minor or other modes
HARMONY_ModalInterchange.rule_being_broken: Stay within diatonic chords of your key; major and minor modes should not mix freely

examples.notation_detail: ♭VII chord (D major) borrowed from E Mixolydian / parallel minor
examples.why_it_works: ♭VII functions as dominant substitute; created characteristic 60s rock sound

examples.notation_detail: B major (III) borrowed from G Lydian, Cm (iv) borrowed from G minor
examples.why_it_works: Creates characteristic happy-to-sad emotional ambiguity; modal mixture

examples.notation_detail: Bbm (iv) borrowed from F minor into F major context
examples.why_it_works: Makes hope feel earned and bittersweet; grief expressed through harmonic darkness

technical_implementation.in_major: Replace IV with iv (Bb → Bbm in F major)

HARMONY_ModalInterchange.emotional_use: bittersweet hope, happy-to-sad ambiguity, making joy feel earned

HARMONY_AvoidTonicResolution.name: Avoided Tonic Resolution
HARMONY_AvoidTonicResolution.description: Ending on non-tonic chord or using ambiguous resolution
HARMONY_AvoidTonicResolution.rule_being_broken: Pieces should resolve to tonic at the end; dominant chords should resolve to tonic

examples.song: Prelude in E Minor, Op. 28 No. 4
examples.notation_detail: m. 23: Chord spelled as dominant 4/2 with B♭ in bass, but B♭ 'resolves' upward to B♮ across fermata
examples.why_it_works: The silence embodies 'negative action' - defined by intention NOT to carry out resolution

examples.notation_detail: Double-tonic complex - never establishes clear tonic between C major and F major
examples.why_it_works: Conflates aspects of both modes; proportion varies throughout

technical_implementation.basic: End on V or vi instead of I
technical_implementation.jazz: End on ♭II7 (tritone substitution) instead of V7

HARMONY_ParallelMotion.name: Parallel Fifths and Octaves
HARMONY_ParallelMotion.description: Two voices moving in parallel perfect 5ths or octaves
HARMONY_ParallelMotion.rule_being_broken: Parallel perfect fifths (P5→P5) and octaves (P8→P8) are forbidden; destroys voice independence

examples.notation_detail: Violins and violas moving in parallel P5 motion in Storm movement
examples.why_it_works: Creates rustic, folk-like quality; evokes peasant dances

examples.notation_detail: Planing - entire triads moving in parallel (C-E-G → D-F#-A → E-G#-B)
examples.why_it_works: Deliberately evokes pre-tonal organum; impressionistic wash of color

examples.notation_detail: Root + P5 moving in parallel (E5→A5→D5)
examples.why_it_works: Intermodulation distortion creates harmonics; parallel motion = massive unified sound

technical_implementation.impressionist: Planing - move entire triads in parallel
technical_implementation.voicing: Remove thirds from chords to emphasize fifths

HARMONY_ParallelMotion.emotional_use: power, defiance, folk energy, impressionistic color

HARMONY_UnresolvedDissonance.name: Unresolved Dissonance
HARMONY_UnresolvedDissonance.description: Dissonances that don't resolve by step to consonances
HARMONY_UnresolvedDissonance.rule_being_broken: Dissonances (7ths, tritones, 2nds) must resolve by step; leading tone must resolve up

examples.notation_detail: Deliberate major 2nd dyads (B♭/A♭) that never resolve; semitone clusters
examples.why_it_works: Wrong notes make sense because they sound wrong in a meaningful way
examples.voicing_formula: Monk voicings = semitone interval at bottom + 3rd on top

examples.notation_detail: 26 chord changes in 16 bars; roots move by major 3rds instead of 5ths
examples.why_it_works: Each V7 resolves to I, but I immediately becomes passing tone to next key

technical_implementation.monk_style: Play notes a semitone below 'correct' note
technical_implementation.coltrane_changes: Cycle through three keys a major 3rd apart
technical_implementation.cluster_voicings: Stack seconds and sevenths without resolution

HARMONY_UnresolvedDissonance.emotional_use: anxiety, complexity, jazz sophistication, intellectual tension

HARMONY_Polytonality.name: Polytonality / Bitonal Superimposition
HARMONY_Polytonality.rule_being_broken: Music should establish and maintain single tonal center

examples.song: The Rite of Spring - Augurs of Spring
examples.notation_detail: E♭7 chord (E♭-G-B♭-D♭) + E major triad (E-G#-B) simultaneously
examples.why_it_works: Neither key wins; creates permanent tension; primal chaos

examples.notation_detail: C major triad + F# major triad (tritone apart)
examples.why_it_works: Represents Petrushka's dual nature (puppet/human)

technical_implementation.tritone_relationship: Use triads a tritone apart (C + F#)
technical_implementation.cluster: Stack multiple triads from different keys

HARMONY_Polytonality.emotional_use: chaos, split identity, primitive energy, modernist complexity

RHYTHM_ConstantDisplacement.name: Constant Metric Displacement
RHYTHM_ConstantDisplacement.description: Continuously shifting meter and accent patterns
RHYTHM_ConstantDisplacement.rule_being_broken: Music should maintain consistent meter; strong beats should fall predictably

examples.song: The Rite of Spring - Sacrificial Dance
examples.why_it_works: Impossible to predict accent pattern; additive rhythms

examples.notation_detail: Ambiguous meter (interpretations: 12/8, 6/8, 4/4, 3/4+5/4)
examples.why_it_works: Piano chords with no discernible pulse until drums enter

RHYTHM_ConstantDisplacement.emotional_use: anxiety, unsettled feeling, off-kilter tension before dramatic shift

RHYTHM_TempoFluctuation.name: Tempo Fluctuation / Rubato

examples.notation_detail: So many notes they don't fit 8ths, 16ths, or triplets - groups of 5 and 7
examples.why_it_works: Dense cascades create thick, wall-like sonic texture

technical_implementation.irregular_groupings: Notes in groups of 5, 7, 11 instead of 2, 3, 4

RHYTHM_TempoFluctuation.emotional_use: intimacy, vulnerability, organic breathing, human imperfection

PRODUCTION_BuriedVocals.name: Buried / Obscured Vocals
PRODUCTION_BuriedVocals.description: Vocals treated as texture rather than focal point
PRODUCTION_BuriedVocals.rule_being_broken: Vocals should be clear and intelligible

examples.notation_detail: Vocals buried under layers of distortion and reverb
examples.why_it_works: Creates dream-like, dissociative atmosphere

examples.notation_detail: Heavily autotuned/processed vocals as primary instrument
examples.why_it_works: Removes human directness, creates otherworldly quality

technical_implementation.level: Mix vocals -6dB to -12dB quieter than typical
technical_implementation.frequency: Roll off high end for distance

PRODUCTION_BuriedVocals.emotional_use: dissociation, dreams, distance, texture over clarity

PRODUCTION_PitchImperfection.name: Intentional Pitch Imperfection
PRODUCTION_PitchImperfection.description: Leaving pitch variations and 'mistakes' in final mix
PRODUCTION_PitchImperfection.rule_being_broken: Vocals and instruments should be perfectly in tune

examples.notation_detail: Slight vocal pitch variations and guitar tuning drift left in
examples.why_it_works: Creates intimacy; feels like sitting in room with artist

examples.notation_detail: Significant pitch and timing variations throughout
examples.why_it_works: Emotional honesty overrides technical perfection

technical_implementation.recording: Use minimal takes, keep first/second take

PRODUCTION_PitchImperfection.emotional_use: raw vulnerability, emotional honesty, lo-fi intimacy

TRITONE_Unresolved.name: Unresolved Tritone
TRITONE_Unresolved.description: Using tritone as foundational interval without resolution
TRITONE_Unresolved.rule_being_broken: Tritone (diabolus in musica) must be resolved
TRITONE_Unresolved.historical_context: Called 'devil's interval' in medieval music; avoided or carefully resolved

examples.notation_detail: G-G(octave)-D♭ - entire riff built on tritone
examples.why_it_works: Tension that begged for resolution becomes identity of genre

examples.notation_detail: Replace V7 with ♭II7 (tritone away) - e.g., G7→D♭7 in C major
examples.why_it_works: Both chords share same tritone (B-F); chromatic bass motion

TRITONE_Unresolved.emotional_use: darkness, tension, sophisticated jazz color, metal heaviness
